Cainhurst Armor.name: Cainhurst Armor
Cainhurst Armor.description:
Silver armor worn by the royal guards who protect Annalise,
Queen of the Vilebloods at Cainhurst Castle.
This paper-thin silver armor is said to deflect blood of ill-
intent, and is what allows the royal guards to capture prey
for their beloved Queen, so that one day, she may bear a
Child of Blood.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Yahar'gul Black Gloves.name: Yahar'gul Black Gloves
Yahar'gul Black Gloves.description:
Thick black gloves worn by hunters of the Unseen Village.
The hunters of Yahar'gul answer to the village's founders,
the School of Mensis. Hunters in name only, these
kidnappers blend into the night wearing this attire.
Designed primarily to defend from physical attacks.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Yahar'gul, Unseen Village (Evening), right path on the Main Street from Yahar'gul Chapel

Sweaty Clothes.name: Sweaty Clothes
Sweaty Clothes.description:
Common Yharnam clothing.
Well-worn and damp with sweat.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Healing Church Workshop, corpse in Village Alleyways on the Lower Section

Yharnam Hunter Cap.name: Yharnam Hunter Cap
Yharnam Hunter Cap.description:
Ludwig, the first hunter of the Healing Church, 
once recruited Yharnamites to serve as hunters.
This hunter's attire was made for new recruits, 
and has excellent straightforward defense.
But not nearly enough to allow an ordinary
man to stand any real chance against the beasts.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Beast Hide Garb.name: Beast Hide Garb
Beast Hide Garb.description:
The bloodied hide of a horrible cleric beast, pulled over the 
back. Without the attacked beast hide this foreigner garb 
wouldn't raise anyone's eyebrows.

Brador donned a compatriot's beastly scalp and hide while 
still moist with blood. Most of the blood stains on this hide 
were from that day.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): 3rd Brador's Phantom in Fishing Hamlet, Flooded Village
Treasure in (Main Story): Fishing Hamlet, Flooded Village if Brador, Church Assassin NPC is dead in his cell.

Maria Hunter Garb.name: Maria Hunter Garb
Maria Hunter Garb.description:
Among the first hunters, all students of Gehrman, was the 
lady hunter Maria. This was her hunter's cap, crafted in 
Cainhurst.

Maria is distantly related to the undead queen, but had great
admiration for Gehrman, unaware of his curious mania.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Harrowed Hood.name: Harrowed Hood
Harrowed Hood.description:
Certain Church hunters obfuscate their identities and slip 
into the nooks and crannies of the city.
This is the garb that allows these harrowed individuals to go 
unnoticed.

These hunters are keen to early signs of the scourge, serving 
as a first line of defense against its outbreak.
Or perhaps, when the time is ripe, they find signs of the 
scourge where there are none. It just goes to show, the 
corner beggar is not always who he seems.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Fishing Hamlet, corpse up the ladder shortcut next to the first Fishing Hamlet lamp

Foreign Garb.name: Foreign Garb
Foreign Garb.description:
Clothing worn upon awakening to the nightmare 
of blood and beasts.
Not typical clothing of Yharnam, perhaps it is of 
foreign origin, It is said, after all, the traveler 
came to Yharnam from afar.
Without memory, who will ever know?
availability_list: Starting Attire

Crown of Illusions.name: Crown of Illusions
Crown of Illusions.description:
One of the precious secrets of Cainhurst.
The old king's crown is said to reveal illusions,
and expose a mirage that hides a secret.
And so Logarius donned the crown of his own volition,
determined to prevent a single soul from stumbling
upon the vile secret.
What visions did he see, sitting serenely upon his 
new throne?
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): Martyr Logarius [100%]

Decorative Old Hunter Trousers.name: Decorative Old Hunter Trousers
Decorative Old Hunter Trousers.description:
Old hunter garb decorated with brass trinkets.

At the time, some hunters believed that certain metals would 
ward off beast blood.
On a night of the hunt, it is no wonder that people would 
resort to superstition.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Research Hall, corpse in room after taking elevator up and from the room ladder down

Bloodied Trousers.name: Bloodied Trousers
Bloodied Trousers.description:
Bloodied foreign trousers.

Brador donned a compatriot's beastly scalp and hide while 
still moist with blood. Most of the blood stains on this hide 
were from that day.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): 2nd Brador's Phantom in cave area in Fishing Hamlet after the Breeding Grounds
Treasure in (Main Story): cave area in Fishing Hamlet after the Breeding Grounds if Brador, Church Assassin NPC is dead in his cell.

Foreign Trousers.name: Foreign Trousers
Foreign Trousers.description:
Trousers worn upon awakening to the nightmare 
of blood and beasts.
Not typical clothing perhaps it is of 
foreign origin. It is said, after all, the traveler 
came to Yharnam from afar.
Without memory, who will ever know?
availability_list: Starting attire

Gold Ardeo.name: Gold Ardeo
Gold Ardeo.description:
The odd helmet worn by the band of Executioners
commanded by the martyr Logarius.
The conical gold helmet, symbol of the executioners,
represents luminosity, ambition, and an unflagging
resolve to face impurity, staring it down with stern,
golden spirit.
As the great Logarius once said, "Act of goodness are
not always wise, and acts of evil are not always foolish,
but regardless, we shall always strive to be good."
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Harrowed Garb.name: Harrowed Garb
Harrowed Garb.description:
Certain Church hunters obfuscate their identities and slip 
into the nooks and crannies of the city.
This is the garb that allows these harrowed individuals to go 
unnoticed.

These hunters are keen to early signs of the scourge, serving 
as a first line of defense against its outbreak.
Or perhaps, when the time is ripe, they find signs of the 
scourge where there are none. It just goes to show, the 
corner beggar is not always who he seems.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Fishing Hamlet, corpse up the ladder shortcut next to the first Fishing Hamlet lamp

Ashen Hunter Gloves.name: Ashen Hunter Gloves
Ashen Hunter Gloves.description:
Attire of the retired hunter Djura. 
Painted with ash in a ceremony to ward off blood.
Djura is known through his contact with the Powder Kegs,
the heretics of the workshop. He is said to have been both
uncommonly kind and dreadfully foolish.
Djura felt defeated by the state of Old Yharnam, and
renounced his hunter's vows.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Hunter Garb.name: Hunter Garb
Hunter Garb.description:
One of the standard articles of hunter attire fashioned at 
the workshop, accompanied with a short cape to wipe away 
blood.
A fine piece of hunter attire that provides stable defence to 
anyone facing Yharnam's beastly threat.
Allows one to stalk beasts unannounced, by cover of night.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Cathedral Ward, outside of Oedon Chapel near Oedon Chapel Well

Madman Leggings.name: Madman Leggings
Madman Leggings.description:
Most tomb prospectors, members of the Healing Church
chose to explore the old labyrinth, are unable to
withstand the weight of the old knowledge, and go mad.
This attire is worn by those lost souls.
Truth often resembles madness, inaccessible to the
dull of mind. Those who go mad are merely thoughtful
souls who failed to reach any conclusions.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Executioner Gauntlets.name: Executioner Gauntlets
Executioner Gauntlets.description:
Gauntlets worn by the band of executioners 
commanded by the martyr Logarius.
The brass rivets are unique to the executioners,
and reflect their adoration of hand-to-hand combat.
As the great Logarius once said, "Acts of goodness are 
not always wise, and acts of evil are not always foolish, 
but regardless, we shall always strive to be good."
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forsaken Cainhurst Castle, before the Library 1F guarded by two Lost Child of Antiquity

Henryk's Hunter Trousers.name: Henryk's Hunter Trousers
Henryk's Hunter Trousers.description:
Hunter's trousers worn by Henryk, the old hunter.
The taciturn old hunter Henryk was once partners with 
Father Gascoigne, and though they were a fierce and gallant 
duo, their partnership led to Henryk's tragically long life.
Henryk's unique yellow garb is resistant to bolt and will be 
of great help to any hunter who has inherited the onus of the 
hunt.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Wine Hakama.name: Wine Hakama
Wine Hakama.description:
Garb of a distant Eastern land, worn by Yamamura the 
Wanderer.

This Eastern warrior pursued a beast for honourable 
revenge, then became a hunter of the League. But when he
stared straight into impurity, it drove him mad.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): Yamamura the Wanderer in Underground Cell in Hunter's Nightmare

Tomb Prospector Trousers.name: Tomb Prospector Trousers
Tomb Prospector Trousers.description:
Attire of tomb prospectors who explore the old labyrinth on 
behalf of the Healing Church.
The Healing Church traces its roots to Byrgenwerth, and is 
therefore aware of the ruins' true importance.
They contain much more than mere hunter trinkets, indeed, 
they hide the very secrets of the old Great Ones, sought after 
by those with the insight to imagine greatness.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Blindfold Cap.name: Blindfold Cap
Blindfold Cap.description:
Attire of the Choir, high-ranking members of 
the Healing Church.
Members of the Choir are both the highest-ranking
clerics of the Healing Church, and scholars who
continue the work that began at Byrgenwerth.
The eye covering indicates their debt to the teachings
of Master Willem, even though their paths diverged.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Upper Cathedral Ward, further Orphanage Corridor

White Church Hat.name: White Church Hat
White Church Hat.description:
Attire of special Church doctors.
These doctors are superiors to the black preventative 
hunters, and specialists in experimentally-backed blood 
ministration and the scourge of the beast.
They believe that medicine is not a means of treatment but 
rather a method for research, and that some knowledge can 
only be obtained by exposing oneself to sickness.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forbidden Woods, Rooftop of the building near caged Rabid Dogs on path to Iosefka's Clinic

Doll Skirt.name: Doll Skirt
Doll Skirt.description:
Discarded doll skirt, likely a spare for dress-up.
A deep love for the doll can be surmised by the fine 
craftsmanship of this article, and the care with which it was 
kept.
It borderlines on mania, and exudes a slight warmth.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Abandoned Old Workshop, outside of the Workshop

Grey Wolf Cap.name: Grey Wolf Cap
Grey Wolf Cap.description:
Attire of the retired hunter Djura. This worn cap was the
lone-wolf's trademark.
Djura is known through his contact with the Powder Kegs,
the heretics of the workshop. He is said to have been both
uncommonly kind and dreadfully foolish.
Djura felt defeated by the state of Old Yharnam, and
renounced his hunter's vows.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Student Trousers.name: Student Trousers
Student Trousers.description:
Uniform of the students of Byrgenwerth, 
a bygone institute of learning. 
The Healing Church has its roots in Byrgenwerth, 
and naturally borrows heavily from its uniform design.
The focus not on knowledge, or thought, but on pure 
pretension would surely bring Master Willem to despair, 
if only he knew.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Lecture Building, corpse in the Lecture Theater 1 left side from the Main Hallway; Byrgenwerth, chest in the College: Lower Floors

Henryk's Hunter Cap.name: Henryk's Hunter Cap
Henryk's Hunter Cap.description:
Hunter's hat worn by Henryk, the old hunter.
The taciturn old hunter Henryk was once partners with 
Father Gascoigne, and though they were a fierce and gallant 
duo, their partnership led to Henryk's tragically long life.
Henryk's unique yellow garb is resistant to bolt and will be 
of great help to any hunter who has inherited the onus of the 
hunt.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Maria Hunter Cap.name: Maria Hunter Cap
Maria Hunter Cap.description:
Among the first hunters, all students of Gehrman, was the 
lady hunter Maria. This was her hunter's cap, crafted in 
Cainhurst.

Maria is distantly related to the undead queen, but had great 
admiration for Gehrman, unaware of his curious mania.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Surgical Long Gloves.name: Surgical Long Gloves
Surgical Long Gloves.description:
White surgical gloves. The intricate embroidery 
weaves a spell that protects their wearer.
The Church engages in the hunt in a medical capacity. 
When a cancer is discovered, one must pinpoint its 
location, reach in, and wrench it from the host's bosom.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Cathedral Ward, Foggy Alley near Arianna, Woman of Pleasure; Forbidden Woods, Rooftop of the building near caged Rabid Dogs on path to Iosefka's Clinic

Crowfeather Manchettes.name: Crowfeather Manchettes
Crowfeather Manchettes.description:
Attire worn by Eileen the Crow, Hunter of Hunters.
Hunters of Hunters dress as crows to suggest sky burial.
The first Hunter of Hunters came from a foreign land, and
gave the dead a virtuous native funeral ritual, rather than
impose a blasphemous Yharnam burial service upon them,
with the hope that former compatriots might be returned to
the skies, and find rest in a hunter's dream.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Doll Clothes.name: Doll Clothes
Doll Clothes.description:
Discarded doll clothing, likely a spare for dress-up.
A deep love for the doll can be surmised by the fine 
craftsmanship of this article, and the care with which it was 
kept.
It borderlines on mania, and exudes a slight warmth.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Abandoned Old Workshop, outside of the Workshop

Black Hooded Iron Helm.name: Black Hooded Iron Helm
Black Hooded Iron Helm.description:
Iron helmet worn by hunters of the Unseen Village.
The hunters of Yahar'gul answer to the village's founders,
the School of Mensis. Hunters in name only, these
kidnappers wear their black hoods low to shadow their
eyes.
This helm is made of metal, a rarity for hunter garb, and has
high defence, but only against physical attacks.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Yahar'gul, Unseen Village (Evening), right path on the Main Street from Yahar'gul Chapel

Butcher Mask.name: Butcher Mask
Butcher Mask.description:
Mask of the Madaras twins, denizens of the Forbidden 
Woods, likely belonging to the older of the two. 

The twins grew up in silent kinship with a poisonous snake. 
Eventually they learned human ways, and became hunters. 

When they discovered vermin even in their beloved snake, 
the younger brother is said to have murdered the older.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Hunter's Nightmare, corpse behind the rocks on left side in Pool of Blood

Gehrman's Hunter Cap.name: Gehrman's Hunter Cap
Gehrman's Hunter Cap.description:
Hunter attire of Gehrman, the first hunter.
Created before the workshop existed by making adjustments 
to everyday clothing, and later became the basis for all
hunter's garb.
The hunter's emphasis on engaging beasts with speed, and
therefore of selecting lightweight attire, no doubt traces back
to Gehrman's own combat style.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Butcher Gloves.name: Butcher Gloves
Butcher Gloves.description:
Gloves of the Madaras twins, denizens of the Forbidden 
Woods, likely belonging to the older of the two.

Both the twins became hunters, and brought back and 
dissected their beast prey, in order to support the villagers in
their forbidden research.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Hunter's Nightmare, corpse behind the rocks on left side in Pool of Blood

Charred Hunter Garb.name: Charred Hunter Garb
Charred Hunter Garb.description:
One of the staple articles of hunter attire, fashioned at the 
workshop.
A product of the scourge of the beast that once plagued Old 
Yharnam and culminated in the town's fiery cleansing.
The cape's dampness makes it highly resistant to fire.
Wearers of this attire hunted down victims of the scourge w
ho survived the raging flames and stench of singed blood.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Old Yharnam, on the top floor of Storage Area where you drop from the Plaza near Djura's Ally

Sullied Bandage.name: Sullied Bandage
Sullied Bandage.description:
Bandage worn upon awakening to the nightmare 
of blood and beasts. Terribly worn and unsanitary.
A faint memory recalls blood ministration, 
involving the transfusion of unknown blood.
Not long after, the nightmare began.
availability_list: Starting Attire

Choir Garb.name: Choir Garb
Choir Garb.description:
Attire of the Choir, high-ranking members of 
the Healing Church.
Members of the Choir are both the highest-ranking
clerics of the Healing Church, and scholars who
continue the work that began at Byrgenwerth.
Together with the left behind Great One,
they look to the skies, in search of astral signs,
that may lead them to the rediscovery of true greatness.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Upper Cathedral Ward, in Orphanage Corridor before the Grand Hall

Knight's Garb.name: Knight's Garb
Knight's Garb.description:
Attire of the knights of Cainhurst.
A regal piece graced by intricate goldwork.
The Cainhurst way is a mix of nostalgia and bombast.
They take great pride even in the blood-stained
corpses of beasts that they leave behind, confident
that they will stand as examples of decadent art.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forsaken Cainhurst Castle, Library 1F secluded Reading Room accessed by the dropping from the Castle Ledges to the Library Balcony

Arianna's Shoes.name: Arianna's Shoes
Arianna's Shoes.description:
Shoes worn by Arianna, woman of the night
in the Cathedral Ward.
Innocent and cute, in contrast with its owner.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): Arianna, Woman of Pleasure [100%]; Small Celestial Emissary [100%] if Arianna is sent to Iosefka's Clinic

Old Hunter Cap.name: Old Hunter Cap
Old Hunter Cap.description:
Old Hunter Cap with a wide brim that hides their sharp gaze.

In the old days, when hunters were ten a penny, this was 
part of their standard garb.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Game): Hunter's Nightmare, corpse on top of stairs from Oedon Chapel

Bone Ash Mask.name: Bone Ash Mask
Bone Ash Mask.description:
A mask made of bone ash, worn by the oldest keepers.           
The keepers, who mind the slumbering great Ones,           
gained eternal life, preserved in ashen form in           
a ceremony of flame that cremated body and soul.            
The long, pointed hat is a symbol of the old keepers            
and is considered evidence of their companionship,            
forged in a certain sin.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Hunter Garb (Cape).name: Hunter Garb (Cape)
Hunter Garb (Cape).description:
One of the standard articles of hunter attire fashioned at 
the workshop, accompanied with a short cape to wipe away 
blood.
A fine piece of hunter attire that provides stable defence to 
anyone facing Yharnam's beastly threat.
Allows one to stalk beasts unannounced, by cover of night.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Central Yharnam, corpse in the sewer near Canal Residence on Aqueduct Path

Knight's Wig.name: Knight's Wig
Knight's Wig.description:
Adornment prized by the knights of Cainhurst.
Resembles a ponytail of silver hair.
The Cainhurst way is a mix of nostalgia and bombast.
They take great pride even in the blood-stained
corpses of beasts that they leave behind, confident
that they will stand as example of decadent art.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forsaken Cainhurst Castle, Library Rooftop

Choir Trousers.name: Choir Trousers
Choir Trousers.description:
Attire of the Choir, high-ranking members of 
the Healing Church.
Members of the Choir are both the highest-ranking
clerics of the Healing Church, and scholars who
continue the work that began at Byrgenwerth.
Together with the left behind Great One,
they look to the skies, in search of astral signs,
that may lead them to the rediscovery of true greatness.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Upper Cathedral Ward, in Orphanage Corridor before the Grand Hall

Yahar'gul Black Garb.name: Yahar'gul Black Garb
Yahar'gul Black Garb.description:
Thick black pullover worn by hunters of the Unseen Village.
The hunters of Yahar'gul answer to the village's founders,
the School of Mensis. Hunters in name only, these
kidnappers blend into the night wearing this attire.
Designed primarily to defend from physical attacks, the
binding of thick rope serves both to protect its wearer, and
restrain his foes.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Yahar'gul, Unseen Village (Evening), right path on the Main Street from Yahar'gul Chapel

Khaki Haori.name: Khaki Haori
Khaki Haori.description:
Garb of a distant Eastern land, worn by Yamamura the 
Wanderer.

This Eastern warrior pursued a beast for honourable 
revenge, then became a hunter of the League. But when he
stared straight into impurity, it drove him mad.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): Yamamura the Wanderer in Underground Cell in Hunter's Nightmare

Charred Hunter Trousers.name: Charred Hunter Trousers
Charred Hunter Trousers.description:
One of the staple articles of hunter attire, fashioned at the 
workshop.
A product of the scourge of the beast that once plagued Old 
Yharnam and culminated in the town's fiery cleansing.
Designed to be highly resistant to fire. Wearers of this attire 
hunted down victims of the scourge who survived the raging 
flames and stench of singed blood.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Old Yharnam, on the top floor of Storage Area where you drop from the Plaza near Djura's Ally

Madman Manchettes.name: Madman Manchettes
Madman Manchettes.description:
Most tomb prospectors, members of the Healing Church
chose to explore the old labyrinth, are unable to
withstand the weight of the old knowledge, and go mad.
This attire is worn by those lost souls.
Truth often resembles madness, inaccessible to the
dull of mind. Those who go mad are merely thoughtful
souls who failed to reach any conclusions.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Knight's Gloves.name: Knight's Gloves
Knight's Gloves.description:
Gloves of the knights of Cainhurst.
A regal piece graced with goldwork on red fabric.
The Cainhurst way is a mix of nostalgia and bombast.
They take great pride even in the blood-stained
corpses of beasts that they leave behind, confident
that they will stand as examples of decadent art.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forsaken Cainhurst Castle, Library 1F secluded Reading Room accessed by the dropping from the Castle Ledges to the Library Balcony

Gascoigne's Trousers.name: Gascoigne's Trousers
Gascoigne's Trousers.description:
Hunter attire worn by Father Gascoigne.
Similar to the hunter garb created at the workshop,
only these are tainted by a pungent beastly stench
that eats away at Gascoigne.
"Father" is a title used for clerics in a foreign land,
and there is no such rank in the Healing Church.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Brador's Testimony.name: Brador's Testimony
Brador's Testimony.description:
The scalp of a horrid cleric beast, indicating that hunter 
Brador, a Healing Church assassin, had killed a compatriot.

Afterward, he wore his ally's own scalp, and hid himself 
away, deep below in a cell. The Church provided him with a 
single, soundless bell of death, to ensure their secrets would 
be kept.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): 4th Brador's Phantom in Underground Cells Hallway in Hunter's Nightmare
Treasure in (Main Story): Underground Cells Hallway in Hunter's Nightmare if Brador, Church Assassin NPC is dead in his cell.

Gascoigne's Garb.name: Gascoigne's Garb
Gascoigne's Garb.description:
Hunter attire worn by Father Gascoigne.
The Dingy scarf is a Holy Shawl and symbol of
the Healing Church, from which Gascoigne would
eventually part ways.
"Father" is a title used for clerics in a foreign land,
and there is no such rank in the Healing Church.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Harrowed Trousers.name: Harrowed Trousers
Harrowed Trousers.description:
Certain Church hunters obfuscate their identities and slip 
into the nooks and crannies of the city.
This is the garb that allows these harrowed individuals to go 
unnoticed.

These hunters are keen to early signs of the scourge, serving 
as a first line of defense against its outbreak.
Or perhaps, when the time is ripe, they find signs of the 
scourge where there are none. It just goes to show, the 
corner beggar is not always who he seems.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Fishing Hamlet, corpse up the ladder shortcut next to the first Fishing Hamlet lamp

Black Church Hat.name: Black Church Hat
Black Church Hat.description:
Attire of Healing Church hunters.
Most Healing Church hunters are elementary doctors 
who understand the importance of early prevention of the scourge, achived by disposing of victims, and 
even potential victims, before signs of sickness manifest themselves.
Their black attire is synonymous with fear, and that peculiar Yharnam madness.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Cathedral Ward, Foggy Street near Arianna, Woman of Pleasure

Yharnam Hunter Garb.name: Yharnam Hunter Garb
Yharnam Hunter Garb.description:
Ludwig, the first hunter of the Healing Church, 
once recruited Yharnamites to serve as hunters.
This hunter's attire was made for new recruits, 
and has excellent straightforward defense.
But not nearly enough to allow an ordinary 
man to stand any real chance against the beasts.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Bloodied Arm Bands.name: Bloodied Arm Bands
Bloodied Arm Bands.description:
Bloodied arm bands.

Brador donned a compatriot's beastly scalp and hide while 
still moist with blood. Most of the blood stains on this hide 
were from that day.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): 1st Brador's Phantom on rooftop area in Fishing Hamlet after the Lighthouse Hut
Treasure in (Main Story): rooftop area in Fishing Hamlet after the Lighthouse Hut if Brador, Church Assassin NPC is dead in his cell.

Henryk's Hunter Gloves.name: Henryk's Hunter Gloves
Henryk's Hunter Gloves.description:
Hunter's attire worn by Henryk, the old hunter.
The taciturn old hunter Henryk was once partners with 
Father Gascoigne, and though they were a fierce and gallant 
duo, their partnership led to Henryk's tragically long life.
Henryk's unique yellow garb is resistant to bolt and will be 
of great help to any hunter who has inherited the onus of the 
hunt.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Beak Mask.name: Beak Mask
Beak Mask.description:
Wood-carved mask of Eileen the Crow, Hunter of Hunters.
The beak contains incense to mask scents of blood and 
beast.
Hunters of Hunters dress as crows to suggest sky burial.
The first Hunter of Hunters came from a foreign land, and
gave the dead a virtuous native funeral ritual, rather than
impose a blasphemous Yharnam burial service upon them,
with the hope that former compatriots might be returned to
the skies, and find rest in a hunter's dream.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Bone Ash Leggings.name: Bone Ash Leggings
Bone Ash Leggings.description:
Leggings made of bone ash, worn by the oldest keepers.            
The keepers, who mind the slumbering great Ones,            
gained eternal life, preserved in ashen form in            
a ceremony of flame that cremated body and soul.           
Now, their frail armor is white and sinewy,            
a window into an arcane lost art.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Black Hood.name: Black Hood
Black Hood.description:
Hood worn upon awakening to the nightmare 
of blood and beasts.
Perhaps its wearer had to stay out of sight, 
and travel by cover of darkness.
Without memory, who will ever know?
availability_list: Starting Attire

Hunter Trousers.name: Hunter Trousers
Hunter Trousers.description:
One of the standard articles of hunter attire fashioned at the 
workshop.
A fine piece of hunter attire that provides stable defence to 
anyone facing Yharnam's beastly threat.
Allows one to stalk beasts unannounced, by cover of night.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Central Yharnam, corpse in the sewer near Canal Residence on Aqueduct Path. Cathedral Ward, corpse near the well left from the Oedon Chapel.

Ashen Hunter Garb.name: Ashen Hunter Garb
Ashen Hunter Garb.description:
Attire of the retired hunter Djura. 
Painted with ash in a ceremony to ward off blood.
Djura is known through his contact with the Powder Kegs,
the heretics of the workshop. He is said to have been both
uncommonly kind and dreadfully foolish.
Djura felt defeated by the state of Old Yharnam, and
renounced his hunter's vows.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Decorative Old Hunter Garb.name: Decorative Old Hunter Garb
Decorative Old Hunter Garb.description:
Old hunter garb decorated with brass trinkets.

At the time, some hunters believed that certain metals would 
ward off beast blood.
On a night of the hunt, it is no wonder that people would 
resort to superstition.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Research Hall, corpse in room after taking elevator up and from the room ladder down

Madman Hood.name: Madman Hood
Madman Hood.description:
Most tomb prospectors, members of the Healing Church
chose to explore the old labyrinth, are unable to
withstand the weight of the old knowledge, and go mad.
This attire is worn by those lost souls.
Truth often resembles madness, inaccessible to the
dull of mind. Those who go mad are merely thoughtful
souls who failed to reach any conclusions.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Bone Ash Armor.name: Bone Ash Armor
Bone Ash Armor.description:
Armor made of bone ash, worn by the oldest keepers.            
The keepers, who mind the slumbering great Ones,            
gained eternal life, preserved in ashen form in            
a ceremony of flame that cremated body and soul.           
Now, their frail armor is white and sinewy,            
a window into an arcane lost art.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Cainhurst Gauntlets.name: Cainhurst Gauntlets
Cainhurst Gauntlets.description:
Silver gauntlets worn by the royal guards who protect
Annalise, Queen of the Vilebloods at Cainhurst Castle.
This paper-thin silver armor is said to deflect blood of ill-
intent, and is what allows the royal guards to capture prey
for their beloved Queen, so that one day, she may bear a
Child of Blood.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Tomb Prospector Gloves.name: Tomb Prospector Gloves
Tomb Prospector Gloves.description:
Attire of tomb prospectors who explore the old labyrinth on 
behalf of the Healing Church.
The Healing Church traces its roots to Byrgenwerth, and is 
therefore aware of the ruins' true importance.
They contain much more than mere hunter trinkets, indeed, 
they hide the very secrets of the old Great Ones, sought after 
by those with the insight to imagine greatness.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Rumpled Yharnam Hat.name: Rumpled Yharnam Hat
Rumpled Yharnam Hat.description:
Common Yharnam cap.

Well-worn and losing its shape.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Healing Church Workshop, corpse in Village Alleyways on the Lower Section

Constable's Garb.name: Constable's Garb
Constable's Garb.description:
Once upon a time, a troupe of foreign constables chased a 
beast all the way to Yharnam, and this is what they wore.
The constables became victims of the beast, except for one 
survivor, who in turn devoured the creature whole, all by 
himself.

The fable is a favorite among Yharnamites, who are partial 
to any stories of pompous, intolerant foreigners who suffer 
for their ignorance. 

It makes the blood taste that much sweeter.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Hunter's Nightmare, corpse across the beams before entering Pool of Blood

Cainhurst Helmet.name: Cainhurst Helmet
Cainhurst Helmet.description:
Silver helmet worn by the royal guards who protect
Annalise, Queen of the Vilebloods at Cainhurst Castle.
This paper-thin silver armor is said to deflect blood of ill-
intent, and is what allows the royal guards to capture prey
for their beloved Queen, so that one day, she may bear a
Child of Blood.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Hunter Hat.name: Hunter Hat
Hunter Hat.description:
One of the standard articles of hunter attire fashioned at the 
workshop.
A fine piece of hunter attire that provides stable defence to 
anyone facing Yharnam's beastly threat.
Allows one to stalk beasts unannounced, by cover of night.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Central Yharnam, corpse in the sewer near Canal Residence on Aqueduct Path

Old Hunter Arm Bands.name: Old Hunter Arm Bands
Old Hunter Arm Bands.description:
Old Hunter arm bands wound tightly to prevent infection
with the scourge.

Of course, the idea that the scourge was infectious was pure
hearsay.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): Yamamura the Wanderer in Underground Cell in Hunter's Nightmare

Enlarged Head.name: Enlarged Head
Enlarged Head.description:
An enlarged head of a patient of the Cathedral, with a cavity 
that just happens to fit a human head, although one would 
be mad to try it on. 

But if you do, listen carefully, for the sticky sound. Drip, 
drop. As water, seeping up from the depths, slowly, steadily.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Game): Research Hall, patient side room on the fifth floor

Gascoigne's Cap.name: Gascoigne's Cap
Gascoigne's Cap.description:
Hunter attire worn by Father Gascoigne.
Similar to the hunter garb created at the workshop,
only these are tainted by a pungent beastly stench
that eats away at Gascoigne.
"Father" is a title used for clerics in a foreign land,
and there is no such rank in the Healing Church.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Black Church Garb.name: Black Church Garb
Black Church Garb.description:
Attire of Healing Church hunters. The Holy Shawl, symbol 
of the Healing Church, flutters proudly on their backs.
Most Healing Church hunters are elementary doctors 
who understand the importance of early prevention of the scourge, achieved by disposing of victims, and even 
potential victims, before signs of sickness manifest 
themselves.
Their black attire is synonymous with fear, 
and that peculiar Yharnam madness.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Cathedral Ward, Foggy Alley near Arianna, Woman of Pleasure

Doll Gloves.name: Doll Gloves
Doll Gloves.description:
Discarded doll gloves, likely a spare for dress-up.
A deep love for the doll can be surmised by the fine 
craftsmanship of this article, and the care with which it was 
kept.
It borderlines on mania, and exudes a slight warmth.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Abandoned Old Workshop, outside of the Workshop

White Church Trousers/Dress.name: White Church Trousers/Dress
White Church Trousers/Dress.description:
Attire of special Church doctors.
These doctors are superiors to the black preventative 
hunters, and specialists in experimentally-backed blood 
ministration and the scourge of the beast.
They believe that medicine is not a means of treatment 
but rather a method for research, and that some knowledge 
can only be obtained by exposing oneself to sickness.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forbidden Woods, Rooftop of the building near caged Rabid Dogs on path to Iosefka's Clinic

Student Uniform (Cape).name: Student Uniform (Cape)
Student Uniform (Cape).description:
Uniform of the students of Byrgenwerth, 
a bygone institute of learning. Features a thick cape.
The Healing Church has its roots in Byrgenwerth, 
and naturally borrows heavily from its uniform design.
The focus not on knowledge, or thought, but on pure 
pretension would surely bring Master Willem to despair, 
if only he knew.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Byrgenwerth, chest in the College: Lower Floors

Graveguard Manchettes.name: Graveguard Manchettes
Graveguard Manchettes.description:
Manchettes of Dores, graveguard of the Forbidden Woods.
Covered in the blood of untidy rituals.
Willem kept two loyal servants back at Byrgenwerth. 
When they were sent into the labyrinth, they encountered 
the eldritch Truth, and went mad. One became the 
password gatekeeper, while Dores became a graveguard 
of the forest.
Both remained loyal, even in madness.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forbidden Woods, after the area where Maneater Boars patrol there is a Log Bridge that you can cross

Yharnam Hunter Trousers.name: Yharnam Hunter Trousers
Yharnam Hunter Trousers.description:
Ludwig, the first hunter of the Healing Church, 
once recruited Yharnamites to serve as hunters.
This hunter's attire was made for new recruits, 
and has excellent straightforward defense.
But not nearly enough to allow an ordinary 
man to stand any real chance against the beasts.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Graveguard Mask.name: Graveguard Mask
Graveguard Mask.description:
Mask of Dores, graveguard of the Forbidden Woods.
His pale countenance mimics the labyrinth watchers. 
Willem kept two loyal servants back at Byrgenwerth. 
When they were sent into the labyrinth, they encountered 
the eldritch Truth, and went mad. One became the 
password gatekeeper, while Dores became a graveguard 
of the forest.
Both remained loyal, even in madness.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forbidden Woods, near where you drop down into the ravine there's section of cliff that sticks out far enough over it that you can actually jump across to the other side

Executioner Garb.name: Executioner Garb
Executioner Garb.description:
Attire worn by the band of executioners
commanded by the martyr Logarius.
Later became that basis for all Church attire,
with its heavy draping of Holy Shawl.
As the great Logarius once said, "Acts of goodness are
not always wise, and acts of evil are not always foolish,
but regardless, we shall always strive to be good."
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forsaken Cainhurst Castle, before the Library 1F guarded by two Lost Child of Antiquity

Ashen Hunter Trousers.name: Ashen Hunter Trousers
Ashen Hunter Trousers.description:
Attire of the retired hunter Djura. 
Painted with ash in a ceremony to ward off blood.
Djura is known through his contact with the Powder Kegs,
the heretics of the workshop. He is said to have been both
uncommonly kind and dreadfully foolish.
Djura felt defeated by the state of Old Yharnam, and
renounced his hunter's vows.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Gascoigne's Gloves.name: Gascoigne's Gloves
Gascoigne's Gloves.description:
Hunter attire worn by Father Gascoigne.
Similar to the hunter garb created at the workshop,
only these are tainted by a pungent beastly stench
that eats away at Gascoigne.
"Father" is a title used for clerics in a foreign land,
and there is no such rank in the Healing Church.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Charred Hunter Gloves.name: Charred Hunter Gloves
Charred Hunter Gloves.description:
One of the staple articles of hunter attire, fashioned at the workshop.
A product of the scourge of the beast that once plagued Old 
Yharnam and culminated in the town's fiery cleansing.
Designed to be highly resistant to fire. Wearers of this attire 
hunted down victims of the scourge who survived the raging 
flames and stench of singed blood.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Old Yharnam, on the top floor of Storage Area where you drop from the Plaza near Djura's Ally

Old Hunter Garb.name: Old Hunter Garb
Old Hunter Garb.description:
Old hunter garb.

One day, the hunters disappeared, and Yharnamites began
to whisper of the hunters' sin.

Drunk with blood, chasing after beasts, they would pass on 
to the Nightmare, every last one of them.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Hunter's Nightmare, corpse on the left side of Lower Grand Cathedral Staircase after Cathedral Plaza

Gehrman's Hunter Garb.name: Gehrman's Hunter Garb
Gehrman's Hunter Garb.description:
Hunter attire of Gehrman, the first hunter.
Created before the workshop existed by making adjustments 
to everyday clothing, and later became the basis for all
hunter's garb.
The hunter's emphasis on engaging beasts with speed, and
therefore of selecting lightweight attire, no doubt traces back
to Gehrman's own combat style.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Doll Hat.name: Doll Hat
Doll Hat.description:
A discarded doll's hat, likely a spare for dress-up.
A deep love for the doll can be surmised by the fine
craftsmanship of this article, and the care with which it was
kept.
It borderlines on mania, and exudes a slight warmth.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Abandoned Old Workshop, outside of the Workshop

Mensis Cage.name: Mensis Cage
Mensis Cage.description:
The School of Mensis controls the Unseen Village.
This hexagonal iron cage suggests their strange ways.
The cage is a device that restrains the will of the self,
allowing one to see the profane world for what it is.
It also serves as an antenna that facilitates contact
with the Great Ones of the dream.
But to an observer, the iron cage appears to be precisely
what delivered them to their harrowing nightmare.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): Micolash, Host of the Nightmare [100%]

Hunter Gloves.name: Hunter Gloves
Hunter Gloves.description:
One of the standard articles of hunter attire fashioned at the 
workshop.
A fine piece of hunter attire the provides stable defence to 
anyone facing Yharnam's beastly threat.
Allows one to stalk beasts unannounced, by cover of night.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Central Yharnam, corpse in the sewer near Canal Residence on Aqueduct Path. Cathedral Ward, corpse near the well left from the Oedon Chapel.

Tomb Prospector Garb.name: Tomb Prospector Garb
Tomb Prospector Garb.description:
Attire of tomb prospectors who explore the old labyrinth on 
behalf of the Healing Church.
The Healing Church traces its roots to Byrgenwerth, and is 
therefore aware of the ruins' true importance.
They contain much more than mere hunter trinkets, indeed, 
they hide the very secrets of the old Great Ones, sought after 
by those with the insight to imagine greatness.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Crowfeather Trousers.name: Crowfeather Trousers
Crowfeather Trousers.description:
Attire worn by Eileen the Crow, Hunter of Hunters.
Hunters of Hunters dress as crows to suggest sky burial.
The first Hunter of Hunters came from a foreign land, and
gave the dead a virtuous native funeral ritual, rather than
impose a blasphemous Yharnam burial service upon them,
with the hope that former compatriots might be returned to
the skies, and find rest in a hunter's dream.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Yamamura Hunter Hat.name: Yamamura Hunter Hat
Yamamura Hunter Hat.description:
A standard hunter's hat, worn by Yamamura the Wanderer.

This hat and staff were given to him when he became a 
hunter and confederate of the League.
availability_list: Dropped by (Main Story): Yamamura the Wanderer in Underground Cell in Hunter's Nightmare

Iron Yahar'gul Helm.name: Iron Yahar'gul Helm
Iron Yahar'gul Helm.description:
Iron helmet worn by hunters of the Unseen Village.
Removing the hood reveals something reminiscent
of a warrior of a previous age.
This headwear is made of metal, a rarity for hunter garb,
and has high defense, but only against physical attacks.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Yahar'gul, Unseen Village (Blood Moon), after the first lamp, near Elevator Plaza

Henryk's Hunter Garb.name: Henryk's Hunter Garb
Henryk's Hunter Garb.description:
Hunter's attire worn by Henryk, the old hunter.
The taciturn old hunter Henryk was once partners with 
Father Gascoigne, and though they were a fierce and gallant 
duo, their partnership led to Henryk's tragically long life.
Henryk's unique yellow garb is resistant to bolt and will be 
of great help to any hunter who has inherited the onus of the 
hunt.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Choir Gloves.name: Choir Gloves
Choir Gloves.description:
Attire of the Choir, high-ranking members of 
the Healing Church.
Members of the Choir are both the highest-ranking
clerics of the Healing Church, and scholars who
continue the work that began at Byrgenwerth.
Together with the left behind Great One,
they look to the skies, in search of astral signs,
that may lead them to the rediscovery of true greatness.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Upper Cathedral Ward, in Orphanage Corridor before the Grand Hall

Old Hunter Top Hat.name: Old Hunter Top Hat
Old Hunter Top Hat.description:
Old hunter top hat, warped by blood stains.

In the old days, when hunters were ten a penny, this was 
part of their standard garb.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Hunter's Nightmare, corpse outside of Bridge Residence leading to River of Blood

Butcher Trousers.name: Butcher Trousers
Butcher Trousers.description:
Trousers of the Madaras twins, denizens of the Forbidden 
Woods, likely belonging to the older of the two.

Both the twins became hunters, and brought back and 
dissected their beast prey, in order to support the villagers in
their forbidden research.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Hunter's Nightmare, corpse behind the rocks on left side in Pool of Blood

Top Hat.name: Top Hat
Top Hat.description:
Hat worn by hunters who admire formality.
Some hunters place an emphasis on form, 
as seen by the use of the threaded cane.
For them, formality, beauty, and justice are 
the very essence of our humanity, and precisely
what keeps hunters from becoming something else.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Cathedral Ward, outside of Oedon Chapel near Oedon Chapel Well

Noble Dress.name: Noble Dress
Noble Dress.description:
A finely tailored bordeaux dress.
Worn by the nobles of the old bloodline that traces back
to the forsaken Castle Cainhurst.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forsaken Cainhurst Castle, chest inside the Banquet Room after the Main Hall

Madman Garb.name: Madman Garb
Madman Garb.description:
Most tomb prospectors, members of the Healing Church
chose to explore the old labyrinth, are unable to
withstand the weight of the old knowledge, and go mad.
This attire is worn by those lost souls.
The appendages draped across them are said to be 
a kind of protective charm, or at least, that is 
what these lost souls believe with all their hearts.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Harrowed Gloves.name: Harrowed Gloves
Harrowed Gloves.description:
Certain Church hunters obfuscate their identities and slip 
into the nooks and crannies of the city.
This is the garb that allows these harrowed individuals to go 
unnoticed.

These hunters are keen to early signs of the scourge, serving 
as a first line of defense against its outbreak.
Or perhaps, when the time is ripe, they find signs of the 
scourge where there are none. It just goes to show, the 
corner beggar is not always who he seems.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Fishing Hamlet, corpse up the ladder shortcut next to the first Fishing Hamlet lamp

Graveguard Kilt.name: Graveguard Kilt
Graveguard Kilt.description:
Leggings of Dores, graveguard of the Forbidden Woods.
Covered in the blood of untidy rituals.
Willem kept two loyal servants back at Byrgenwerth. 
When they were sent into the labyrinth, they encountered 
the eldritch Truth, and went mad. One became the 
password gatekeeper, while Dores became a graveguard 
of the forest.
Both remained loyal, even in madness.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forbidden Woods, after the area where Maneater Boars patrol there is a Log Bridge that you can cross

Black Church Trousers/Dress.name: Black Church Trousers/Dress
Black Church Trousers/Dress.description:
Attire of Healing Church hunters.
Most Healing Church hunters are elementary doctors 
who understand the importance of early prevention of 
the scourge, achived by disposing of victims, and 
even potential victims, before signs of sickness manifest 
themselves.
Their black attire is synonymous with fear, 
and that peculiar Yharnam madness.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Cathedral Ward, Foggy Alley near Arianna, Woman of Pleasure

Old Hunter Gloves.name: Old Hunter Gloves
Old Hunter Gloves.description:
Old hunter gauntlets made of brass to protect their weapon-
bearing hands.

At the time, some hunters believed that certain metals would 
ward off beast blood.
On a night of the hunt, it is no wonder that people would 
resort to superstition.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Hunter's Nightmare, corpse on roof ledge next to main staircase outside of Oedon Chapel

Tomb Prospector Hood.name: Tomb Prospector Hood
Tomb Prospector Hood.description:
Attire of tomb prospectors who explore the old labyrinth on 
behalf of the Healing Church.
The Healing Church traces its roots to Byrgenwerth, and is 
therefore aware of the ruins' true importance.
They contain much more than mere hunter trinkets, indeed, 
they hide the very secrets of the old Great Ones, sought after 
by those with the insight to imagine greatness.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Maria Hunter Gloves.name: Maria Hunter Gloves
Maria Hunter Gloves.description:
Among the first hunters, all students of Gehrman, was the 
lady hunter Maria. This was her hunter's cap, crafted in 
Cainhurst.

Maria is distantly related to the undead queen, but had great
admiration for Gehrman, unaware of his curious mania.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Yharnam Hunter Gloves.name: Yharnam Hunter Gloves
Yharnam Hunter Gloves.description:
Ludwig, the first hunter of the Healing Church, 
once recruited Yharnamites to serve as hunters.
This hunter's attire was made for new recruits, 
and has excellent straightforward defense.
But not nearly enough to allow an ordinary 
man to stand any real chance against the beasts.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Graveguard Robe.name: Graveguard Robe
Graveguard Robe.description:
Robe of Dores, graveguard of the Forbidden Woods.
Countless bloodied ritual tools hang from its back.
Willem kept two loyal servants back at Byrgenwerth. 
When they were sent into the labyrinth, they encountered 
the eldritch Truth, and went mad. One became the 
password gatekeeper, while Dores became a graveguard 
of the forest.
Both remained loyal, even in madness.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forbidden Woods, after the area where Maneater Boars patrol there is a Log Bridge that you can cross

White Church Garb.name: White Church Garb
White Church Garb.description:
Attire of special Church doctors.
These doctors are superiors to the black preventative 
hunters, and specialists in experimentally-backed blood 
ministration and the scourge of the beast.
They believe that medicine is not a means of treatment but 
rather a method for research, and that some knowledge 
can only be obtained by exposing oneself to sickness.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forbidden Woods, Rooftop of the building near caged Rabid Dogs on path to Iosefka's Clinic

Student Uniform.name: Student Uniform
Student Uniform.description:
Uniform of the students of Byrgenwerth, a bygone institute
learning. This alternative lacks the thick cape.

This Healing Church has its roots in Byrgenwerth, and
naturally borrows heavily from its uniform design.

The focus not on knowledge, or thought, but on pure
pretension would surely bring Master Willem to despair,
if only he knew.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Lecture Building, corpse in the Lecture Theater 1 left side from the Main Hallway

Executioner Trousers.name: Executioner Trousers
Executioner Trousers.description:
Attire worn by the band of executioners
commanded by the martyr Logarius.
Later became that basis for all Church attire.
As the great Logarius once said, "Acts of goodness are
not always wise, and acts of evil are not always foolish,
but regardless, we shall always strive to be good."
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forsaken Cainhurst Castle, before the Library 1F guarded by two Lost Child of Antiquity

Yahar'gul Black Trousers.name: Yahar'gul Black Trousers
Yahar'gul Black Trousers.description:
Thick black trousers worn by hunters of the Unseen Village.
The hunters of Yahar'gul answer to the village's founders,
the School of Mensis. Hunters in name only, these
kidnappers blend into the night wearing this attire.
Designed primarily to defend from physical attacks.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Yahar'gul, Unseen Village (Evening), right path on the Main Street from Yahar'gul Chapel

Maria Hunter Trousers.name: Maria Hunter Trousers
Maria Hunter Trousers.description:
Among the first hunters, all students of Gehrman, was the 
lady hunter Maria. This was her hunter's cap, crafted in 
Cainhurst.

Maria is distantly related to the undead queen, but had great
admiration for Gehrman, unaware of his curious mania.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Old Hunter Trousers.name: Old Hunter Trousers
Old Hunter Trousers.description:
Old hunter trousers that protected countless hunters from
the beasts in an older age.

A widespread belief of the period was that "beast blood crept
up the right leg," and this led to the double-wrapped belt.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Game): Hunter's Nightmare, corpse on the ledge above the lever for Oedon Chapel gate

Butcher Garb.name: Butcher Garb
Butcher Garb.description:
Garb of the Madaras twins, denizens of the Forbidden 
Woods, likely belonging to the older of the two.

Both the twins became hunters, and brought back and 
dissected their beast prey, in order to support the villagers in 
their forbidden research.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Hunter's Nightmare, corpse behind the rocks on left side in Pool of Blood

Cainhurst Leggings.name: Cainhurst Leggings
Cainhurst Leggings.description:
Silver leggings worn by the royal guards who protect 
Annalise, Queen of the Vilebloods at Cainhurst Castle.
This paper-thin silver armor is said to deflect blood of ill-
intent, and is what allows the royal guards to capture prey
for their beloved Queen, so that one day, she may bear a
Child of Blood.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Knight's Trousers/Dress.name: Knight's Trousers/Dress
Knight's Trousers/Dress.description:
Attire of the knights of Cainhurst.
A regal piece made with the finest leather.
The Cainhurst way is a mix of nostalgia and bombast.
They take great pride even in the blood-stained
corpses of beasts that they leave behind, confident
that they will stand as examples of decadent art.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Forsaken Cainhurst Castle, Library 1F secluded Reading Room accessed by the dropping from the Castle Ledges to the Library Balcony

Crowfeather Garb.name: Crowfeather Garb
Crowfeather Garb.description:
Attire worn by Eileen the Crow, Hunter of Hunters,
known in particular for her crowfeather cape.
Hunters of Hunters dress as crows to suggest sky burial.
The first Hunter of Hunters came from a foreign land, and
gave the dead a virtuous native funeral ritual, rather than
impose a blasphemous Yharnam burial service upon them,
with the hope that former compatriots might be returned to
the skies, and find rest in a hunter's dream.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Gehrman's Hunter Trousers.name: Gehrman's Hunter Trousers
Gehrman's Hunter Trousers.description:
Hunter attire of Gehrman, the first hunter.
Created before the workshop existed by making adjustments 
to everyday clothing, and later became the basis for all
hunter's garb.
The hunter's emphasis on engaging beasts with speed, and
therefore of selecting lightweight attire, no doubt traces back
to Gehrman's own combat style.
availability_list: Sold by: Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Constable's Gloves.name: Constable's Gloves
Constable's Gloves.description:
Once upon a time, a troupe of foreign constables chased a 
beast all the way to Yharnam, and this is what they wore.
The constables became victims of the beast, except for one 
survivor, who in turn devoured the creature whole, all by 
himself.

The fable is a favorite among Yharnamites, who are partial 
to any stories of pompous, intolerant foreigners who suffer 
for their ignorance. 

It makes the blood taste that much sweeter.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Hunter's Nightmare, corpse at the end of upper path up the staircase from River of Blood

Bone Ash Gauntlets.name: Bone Ash Gauntlets
Bone Ash Gauntlets.description:
Gauntlets made of bone ash, worn by the oldest keepers.       
The keepers, who mind the slumbering great Ones,            
gained eternal life, preserved in ashen form in            
a ceremony of flame that cremated body and soul.           
Now, their frail armor is white and sinewy,            
a window into an arcane lost art.
availability_list: Sold by: Insight Bath Messengers [Hunter's Dream]

Constable's Trousers.name: Constable's Trousers
Constable's Trousers.description:
Once upon a time, a troupe of foreign constables chased a 
beast all the way to Yharnam, and this is what they wore.
The constables became victims of the beast, except for one 
survivor, who in turn devoured the creature whole, all by 
himself.

The fable is a favorite among Yharnamites, who are partial 
to any stories of pompous, intolerant foreigners who suffer 
for their ignorance. 

It makes the blood taste that much sweeter.
availability_list: Treasure in (Main Story): Hunter's Nightmare, corpse on the left path from Bridge Residence through River of Blood, guarded by Bloodlickers
